title: KeenWiki now online!
content:
Hi everyone,

The KeenWiki is now up and running. I only just transferred the domain across to the new server so you may or may not be able to access it for the next 24 hours, but after that you shouldn't have any trouble at all. The "real" URL is:

[url=http://www.shikadi.net/keenwiki/] http://www.shikadi.net/keenwiki/[/url]

However Grafix has kindly created a redirect you may also find helpful:

[url=http://wiki.commanderkeen.org] http://wiki.commanderkeen.org[/url]

This will forward to the first URL above, but it will also accept article names - so if you're e-mailing links around, you may find something like this more explanatory:

[url=http://wiki.commanderkeen.org/Standard_Galactic_Alphabet] http://wiki.commanderkeen.org/Standard_Galactic_Alphabet[/url]

It's up to you which URL you want to use.

You will need to create an account before you can start editing pages, and I recommend on your "user" page you list your PCKF username (especially if you've picked a different username for the wiki.) Feel free to link to put a link to your homepage here too!

There's a base structure on there at the moment but this is only a guide - if you can see a better way of doing something, then by all means go ahead and do it. If you're worried your change might be drastic, you can always discuss it here first (there are discussion pages on the wiki for this, but we'll have to wait until the wiki reaches a certain size before there will be enough people to keep an eye on those!)

I hope everyone dives in and has some fun documenting anything and everything Keen-related! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

content:
Wow, talk about 'diving in', it's great to see so many people get stuck in and contribute lots of quality material!

Along the lines of what DaVince said, I think we will need to create more categories. When I started the basic structure I wasn't familiar with categories, but now that I am I agree that this is a better way of organising things (and I am also going through categorising the pages now.) Once this has been done, I will move things like the [url=http://www.shikadi.net/keenwiki/Index_of_Creatures]Index of Creatures[/url] so that they point to the category instead.

One other thing - when uploading images, although .gif files are permitted please try to use .png instead if at all possible!

title: Re: KeenWiki now online!
content:
.png files should come out out smaller than .gif if you correctly save them as 4-bit images, so there shouldn't be a problem there (at any rate .png is completely open and .gif is still tarnished by the whole patent issue, so I think it would be safer to stick with the newer .png format anyway.)

Also, on a minor formatting issue, I've noticed that when people are creating articles they are bolding the name of the article in the intro, for example on the Omegamatic page it might say:

This is the Omegamatic.

This is fine and recommended, however I've noticed it's often done like this:

This is the '''Omegamatic'''.

Which simply bolds the text as is. I think it would be better to do it like this:

This is the [[Omegamatic]].

Since you can't link to the page you're already on, on the Omegamatic page that word would appear bold, but if the wikicode is ever copied or moved onto another page suddenly the link would become live. If ''' was used then in this situation the text would remain bold after it was copied.

Nothing major, but I think it could help long term maintenance using [[ ]] instead.

You might want to double-size the images first though, I think when they're double-sized they look more like the original games (which were quite pixellated) and it makes the images come out at a decent size (otherwise it's quite difficult to fit a caption under the image.)

title: Re: Re:
content:
Well, that is true, but Malv himself suggested me to double the pics because I first uploaded them in the original size. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img] 3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"

title: Re: Re:
content:
The problem is that (as Shadow Master found out) not all browsers resize images properly - some try to interpolate the image to make real photos look nicer, but they make pixellated images just look blurry.

Plus, since we're using .png the compression is good enough that going from 1077 bytes to 1153 bytes (in the case of the Sprite image) really isn't going to be a problem. This is one of those things where there are always going to be arguments for doing it one way over the other, and as with most things I don't believe there's a right and a wrong, it depends on the situation. I think this way works best for the small preview images dotted all over the wiki, which is why it has been done like this so far.

I'm more worried about *downsizing* the level images - a .png of a full Keen level is about 120kB depending on the level, but when you click on the image to get a medium size preview the MediaWiki code resizes it to an RGB .png file which is often over 1MB. Click on the image again to download the "high resolution" version and you get the 120kB 16-colour .png image...

[quote]Quote:[hr]The problem is that (as Shadow Master found out) not all browsers resize images properly - some try to interpolate the image to make real photos look nicer, but they make pixellated images just look blurry.[hr][/quote]

I couldn't find anything on that in this thread.
I'm curious which browsers do that.

Hmmm, the MediaWiki image code does sound somewhat inappropriate for a project like this then.
I suppose it's possible to rewrite it to suit 16 colour images better, but that'll be a bit of work.
It should be possible with PHP, which I'm relatively sure the code is written in, although I have no idea if you're allowed to.
PHP.net's description doesn't really clarify the whole image/colours/size thing, so testing would probably be necessary.
Maybe simply turning the image into a GIF in the end is enough to leave the file small.

title: Re: KeenWiki now online!
content:
Umm... How the hell is this factual?

"The ever popular Stuffed Toy Vortininja is produced by Epic Megagames in their main factory on Bloxonius. They are sold almost exclusively on Vorticon VI and Keen encounters them in Keen 3. They are rather expensive and highly prized, being worth 5000 points (four for an extra life.) They are designed to a similar template to Earth Teddy Bears and are used for the same ends.

Keen donated all of the toy Vortininjas he acquired to the Rufus Page Trust for Injured Vorticon Youth; there being a lot more patients after Keen's visit.

Retrieved from "[url=http://www.shikadi.net/keenwiki/Stuffed_Toy_Vortininja]www.shikadi.net/keenwiki/...ortininja"[/url]~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
I've changed a lot since my last time on this forum...

title: Re: KeenWiki now online!

title: Re: KeenWiki now online!
content:
It's still a work in progress - I didn't want to officially announce it until I'd at least got more than a couple of pages done [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

You're all more than welcome to poke around and maybe even contribute to it though, in its current beta state. The wikis aren't linked though, so you will need to create another account if you want to edit pages (sorry.)

The ModdingWiki is intended primarily to document all the file formats used by the "classic games" of the Keen era. I realised while I was working on my game editor that the only place where most of these formats are documented is deep within the code of various editors all around the place (e.g. Wombat.) I thought it would be a good idea to have a central place to document all this, so that anyone wanting to write some sort of modding utility could easily get hold of some technical docs on the file formats that a game uses. (For an example of this, go to the [url=http://www.shikadi.net/moddingwiki/Jill_of_the_Jungle]Jill of the Jungle[/url] page and click on the link to the map format.)

A second reason was to have a place where modders could go to get a list of programs that would mod specific games. (e.g. if you fancy modding Monster Bash, eventually you'll be able to go to the Monster Bash page on the ModdingWiki and see a list of modding tools you could use.)

So Shadow Master, seeing as you're now a coder who's released some modding tools, don't forget to drop by the ModdingWiki and document some of the file formats that your tools use [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

title: Re: KeenWiki now online!
content:
I had a list of the Jill of the Jungle object types, but it was on another computer. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-sad.gif[/img]

I was trying to figure them out again, but I didn't get that far...------------------
[url=http://www.ericmushroomwilson.co.uk/] My website[/url]

title: Re: KeenWiki now online!
content:
Registered in the ModdingWiki.

I also added some Keen cameos to the cameos section, specifically his cameos in Duke Nukum, Crystal Caves, Bio Menace, and the Duke3D HRP. These are the only ones I can recall by now. I wonder if it'd be possible to add screenshots of his cameos... or would that be spoiling/copyright infringement?

And, now that we have so many Keen mods in the wiki, would not it be a good idea to add fan-games too?------------------------------

[url=http://p072.ezboard.com/fpubliccommanderkeenforumfrm20.showMessage?topicID=12.topic]Get Windows/Linux native LModKeen 2 with integrated FIN2BMP![/url]. You know you want to.

title: Re: KeenWiki now online!
content:
Well I've certainly no problem with adding fangames, if they're done in the same way as mods were. I also think it's a great idea to add screenshots of the cameo appearances, I think this comes under "fair use" as far as copyright is concerned.

I've been thinking of making you a KeenWiki admin for a while now Shadow Master, which I have now done, so next time you log in you'll have access to edit the main page if you do go ahead and decide to start adding fangames to the wiki. Have fun! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]
